intro: Murdannia dimorphoides, commonly known as the two-form grass, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its erect, sometimes branched stems. The plant typically has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in spikes, and its seeds are enclosed in three-valved capsules. Murdannia dimorphoides is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
